homeOfficeAppealLate.title: Your appeal is late
homeOfficeAppealLate.description:
Appeals should be made within 14 days of the date the decision letter was sent.
You may still be able to appeal. Please tell us why your appeal is late, and provide supporting evidence if you have it.
homeOfficeAppealLate.provideEvidenceDescription: You can upload evidence to support your answer such as letters, photos and documents. If you are taking a picture of a letter, place it on a flat surface and take the picture from above.

wrongHomeOfficeDecision.title: Home Office Decision
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.heading: Why do you think the Home Office decision is wrong?
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.usefulInfo: It may be helpful to look at the Home Office documents (opens in a new window). They include your decision letter and other information about your case.
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.textTitle: Tell us in your own words - you don't have to have perfect English.
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.bulletOne: Carefully read your Home Office decision letter
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.bulletTwo: Try to understand the parts of your claim the Home Office disagrees with
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.bulletThree: Respond to some or all the things the Home Office disagrees with
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.bulletFour: Tell us about anything new that will affect your case since you made your claim
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.bulletFive: Include supporting evidence where you can. You can do this on the next page
wrongHomeOfficeDecision.bulletLink: Find organisations that can help you with your appeal

protection.title: Protection (You will be persecuted or harmed in some way if you are returned to your home country)
protection.examples: You might be afraid of the government, police or other groups in your home country because of your nationality, race, religion, political opinion or other reason.
